verses.roman:
setubandha paryanta kailā bhaktira pracāra
kṛṣṇa-prema diyā kailā sabāra nistāra

synonyms: setubandha—the place where Lord Rāmacandra constructed His bridge; paryanta—up to that place; kailā—did; bhaktira—of the cult of devotional service; pracāra—broadcast; kṛṣṇa-prema—love of Kṛṣṇa; diyā—delivering; kailā—did; sabāra—everyone; nistāra—deliverance.
translation: Thus the Lord went to the southernmost tip of the Indian peninsula, known as Setubandha [Cape Comorin]. Everywhere He distributed the bhakti cult and love of Kṛṣṇa, and in this way He delivered everyone.
